counselor_profile.workload_profile: Daily problem sets, heavy conceptual homework, fast pace.

notes_and_context: A very rigorous course. Moves much faster than NC Math 3 Honors and is designed to be a direct prep course for AP Calculus.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Intense daily problem sets, conceptual work, high pace.

notes_and_context: Covers one semester of college-level calculus. Requires a very strong foundation from AP Precalculus.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Extremely fast-paced daily problem sets, covers all of AB plus more.

notes_and_context: Covers two semesters of college-level calculus. Extremely fast and difficult. The 'BC' score includes an 'AB' subscore.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Case studies, lab reports, concept memorization, some projects.

notes_and_context: Often considered one of the 'easier' AP sciences. Success is based more on memorization and unit mastery than on complex math skills.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Nightly college-level reading, document analysis, timed essay writing (DBQ, LEQ).
counselor_profile.exam_format: MCQ, Short Answer (SAQ), Document-Based Question (DBQ), Long Essay (LEQ)

notes_and_context: A 'firehose' of information. Extremely fast-paced. Success depends on your ability to read, write, and memorize huge amounts of content.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Problem sets, reading and interpreting data, heavy calculator use.

notes_and_context: A reading-and-writing-based math class. Different from calculus. You must be able to justify your answers in clear sentences.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Memorizing foundational documents and court cases, reading, timed-writing.

notes_and_context: A content-heavy class focused on memorizing the structure of US government. Less reading than APUSH, but more abstract concepts.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Portfolio-based, heavy independent time commitment, studio work, artist statements.
counselor_profile.exam_format: Portfolio Submission (Sustained Investigation, Selected Works). No final exam.

notes_and_context: Difficulty is 100% based on the immense time commitment (20+ pieces) and creative effort required for the portfolio.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Portfolio-based, heavy independent time commitment, studio work, artist statements.
counselor_profile.exam_format: Portfolio Submission (Sustained Investigation, Selected Works). No final exam.

notes_and_context: Difficulty is 100% based on the immense time commitment (20+ pieces) and creative effort required for the portfolio.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Portfolio-based, heavy independent time commitment, studio work, artist statements.
counselor_profile.exam_format: Portfolio Submission (Sustained Investigation, Selected Works). No final exam.

notes_and_context: Difficulty is 100% based on the immense time commitment (20+ pieces) and creative effort required for the portfolio.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Full immersion. Daily speaking, listening to media, reading texts, writing essays in French.

notes_and_context: A college-level immersion course. Success depends on your willingness to speak, read, and write exclusively in French.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Intense translation of classical texts (Virgil, Caesar), literary analysis, grammar review.

notes_and_context: A very difficult literature and translation class. Requires mastery of all grammar from Latin I-IV.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Full immersion. Daily speaking, listening to media, reading texts, writing essays in Spanish.

notes_and_context: A college-level immersion course. Much easier for native/heritage speakers. Success depends on willingness to speak, read, and write exclusively in Spanish.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Reading and analyzing a mandatory list of Spanish literary works, writing analytical essays.
counselor_profile.exam_format: MCQ, FRQ (Text Analysis, Text Comparison, Art Comparison)

notes_and_context: A college-level *literature* class, not a language class. Taught entirely in Spanish. Requires fluency and strong analytical writing skills.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Project-based work, some block-based coding, writing about code.

notes_and_context: A broad, conceptual introduction to computer science. Focuses on the 'big ideas' of the internet, data, and programming.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Daily, intensive coding projects in Java. Heavy focus on logic and debugging.

notes_and_context: A college-level 'Intro to Java' programming course. Very logic-intensive. Success depends on your ability to think like a programmer.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Heavy problem sets, demanding lab reports, fast-paced content coverage.

notes_and_context: One of the most difficult APs. Requires strong conceptual understanding AND strong math skills. The jump from Honors Chem is significant.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Problem sets, lab reports, conceptual questions.

notes_and_context: Deceptively difficult. The math is algebra, but the concepts are deeply challenging. The AP exam has a notoriously low 5 rate.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Case-study analysis of 6 countries (UK, Russia, China, Iran, Nigeria, Mexico).

notes_and_context: A 'case-study' class. You must memorize and compare the political systems of 6 specific countries.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Intense vocabulary and concept memorization. Daily reading.

notes_and_context: A 'memorization-hard' class. The concepts are easy, but the sheer *volume* of vocabulary is immense. Success is 90% memorization.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Constant reading of non-fiction, rhetorical analysis essays, timed writing.

notes_and_context: A college-level writing class. Focuses on *how* an argument is built. Success depends on your analytical writing skill, not memorization.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Graphing, concept review, problem sets.

notes_and_context: Focuses on 'big picture' economics (countries, GDP, inflation). Conceptual and graph-based.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Heavy graphing, problem sets, concept review.

notes_and_context: Focuses on 'small picture' economics (individuals, firms, supply/demand). Very graph-heavy.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Problem sets, lab reports, conceptual questions (E&M, fluids).

notes_and_context: A continuation of AP Physics 1. Covers electricity, magnetism, and fluids. Also has a very low 5 rate.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Intense calculus-based problem sets, labs.

notes_and_context: This is AP Physics 1 *with calculus*. It is a must-take for engineering. Requires concurrent enrollment in AP Calculus.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Intense memorization, college-level textbook reading, complex lab reports.

notes_and_context: A 'double-hard' class. Requires both massive memorization (like AP Psych) and complex conceptual understanding (like AP Chem).

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Heavy reading of fiction, poetry, and drama. Deep thematic analysis. Timed writing.

notes_and_context: A college-level literature class. Focuses on *why* a story is told. Success depends on your ability to analyze abstract themes and literary devices.

counselor_profile.workload_profile: Nightly college-level reading, document analysis, timed essay writing (DBQ, LEQ).
counselor_profile.exam_format: MCQ, Short Answer (SAQ), Document-Based Question (DBQ), Long Essay (LEQ)

notes_and_context: Notoriously one of the most content-heavy APs. A massive volume of reading, memorization, and writing. A huge step up from Honors.
